basics.name: Simon T Engler
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD candidate in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii.

publications.publications: Planetary Exploration Habitat Energy Requirements and Forecasting
publications.author: Engler S., Binsted K., Leung H.,

work.summary: TA for ISC 419 Machine Learning and ICS 349 Software Engineering I
RA to Dr. Binsted helping with research and operations of the HI-SEAS experiment
Selected out of 700 applcants to be the Crew Engineer in the first Hawaii Space Exploration Analog and Simulation (HI-SEAS) for a four month isolation mission
Carnegie Mellon University working on ZoÃ« a Mars rover prototype developing interface software
Combat Engineer in the Canadian Forces. Worked Improvised Explosive Device (IED) hunter.
Developed software for a GUI interface and GPS guided agricultural systems
Summer student at Environment Canada over three consecutive summers programming an emergency response oil spill simulation software

awards.title: Best Student Paper
awards.summary: Awarded best student paper at Unmanned Systems Canada Conference, Halifax, Canada

awards.title: Cheif of Land Staff Commendation
awards.summary: For my work developing and coding a training computer game for the Army. Also for work depticting IED Tactical videos using AI bots in game engine

awards.title: Canadian Expeditionary Force Commanders Coin
awards.awarder: General Lessard, Commander Canadian Expedition Task Forces
awards.summary: For the development, construction, and field testing of the Prairie Dog robot in a combat environment in Afghanistan

awards.title: Combat Engineer Task Force Afghanistan Commander's Coin
awards.awarder: Colonel Gilmore, HQ5-09 Task Force Engineers Commander
awards.summary: Coin given to me by Colonel Gilmore, head of the Canadian Combat Engineers Afghanistan Task Force, for my work with the design, construction, testing, and implementation of the Prairie Dog C-IED robotic platform. Coins are given as recognition for outstanding service/performance in the Canadian Army at the discretion of the issuer.
